narrative: On June 2, 2021, at 4:30PM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection, via phone call, with Patricia White, Assistant Program Director for McKinley Children's Center Short Therapeutic Residential Treatment Program (STRTP). The purpose of the inspection was to gather information about the below incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on 10/08/20, at approximately 4:43PM Child Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 dated 06/02/21) placed both hands around Staff Johnnie Johnson's neck and began choking him. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Talesha Payne, Administrator. Copies from C1's file were requested and provided. The statement obtained and documentation reviewed revealed that on 10/08/21, C1 exited the recreation center and began walking towards the agency exit, walked over to a bush and retrieved a scooter he had hidden there. C1 exited the STRTP grounds and rode his scooter into the San Dimas Sports Complex. Mr. Johnson secured a van to follow C1. cont.# Staff Johnson saw C1 and stopped to counsel C1 and C1 agreed to enter the van and return to the STRTP. Staff Johnson began driving back to the STRTP, however, he immediately pulled over due to C1 opening the van door while the vehicle was in motion. C1 then jumped out of the van and attempted to take Staff Johnson's walkie-talkie. As Staff Johnson pulled away and was driving to return to the STRTP, C1 placed both of his arms around Staff Johnson's neck and began choking him. Staff Johnson stopped the van and used Pro-Act to free himself as he began to feel dizzy. Staff Johnson was able to free himself, causing C1's grip to loosen. The San Dimas Sheriff Department was called, and C1 was cited for Battery on an elderly person and was released back to the facility custody. C1 was discharged on 10/29/20 due to been detained and sent to Juvenile Hall. C1 did not return to the facility. No further inspection is needed. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the facility representative. Exit interview conducted.

On August 9, 2021, at 8:30AM, Licensing Program Analysts (LPAS) Claudia Portillo and Humberto Flores, conducted an unannounced Annual Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Therapeutic Residential Treatment (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. LPAs stated the purpose of the inspection to the STRTP representative. During the inspection a copy of the Register of Facility Clients and Personnel Report was provided upon request. The following topics were inspected: PHYSICAL PLANT: A tour of the facility was conducted, along with Patricia White. The License is placed in a prominent place, in the reception are of the facility. Children's foster rights were posted in all Cottages: Whittier, Kiwanis, Campbell and Gregory. LPA Flores observed that the facility is clean, safe, sanitary and in good repair. The passageways and ramps are unobstructed. There is swimming pool located in the south west area of the facility that is fenced, locked and inaccessible to the children. cont.# The disinfectants and cleaning solutions were stored away from the kitchen areas, food preparation areas to the children. The food is safe and of the quality and the quantity necessary to meet the needs of the clients. Each meal meets at least 1/3 of the recommended in the USDA Basic Food Group Plan-Daily Food Guide. Supplies of staples non-perishable foods for one week and perishable foods for two days are maintained in the facility. Medications are locked and accessible only to employees supervising stored medications. The temperature in the rooms that clients occupy are maintained between 68 and 85 degrees (F) and the hot water temperature was at 110 degrees (F). Emergency Intervention Plan: LPA Portillo reviewed the program statement and PROACT instruction manual and identified the training that is provided for all staff. The staff receive on-going training to maintain certification. A monthly log is utilized to document manual restraints to assist with the Bi-Annual Restraint Report. Disaster Preparedness Plan: LPA Portillo reviewed the disaster and mass casualty plan and other provisions by reviewing the program statement. The facility conducts monthly fire and emergency evacuation drills. Drills are documented and kept in the facilty for at least one year. # CLIENT RECORDS: LPA Flores reviewed the three (3) client file records. Needs and services plans for all three clients were trauma informed, culturally relevant, and age and developmentally appropriate and identified the child's needs: reason for placement, education, personal care and grooming, ability to manage money, visitation information, mental health services and placement information CORE THERAPEUTIC SERVICES: During the inspection review, LPAs were able to see that the facility is providing the Short-Term Therapeutic Program (STRTP) core services and support to the individuals in placement. The facility has trauma informed, culturally relevant, age, and developmentally appropriate. The facility is also providing trauma informed core services through agreements with other agencies. The facilty has a culinary arts program, cultural sensitivity, tennis, equine therapy and a music program for all clients in care. OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: During the inspection review, LPAs observed the facility maintained an updated roster of the clients with pertinent information. The facility administrator and manager are the responsible and capable staff for communicating with emergency personnel in the facility. The facility has developed, maintained and implemented written complaint procedures. Further inspection is required on a separate day.

On August 9, 2021, at 10:20AM, Licensing Program Analysts (LPAS) Claudia Portillo and Humberto Flores, conducted an unannounced Annual Inspection-Continuation at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Therapeutic Residential Treatment (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. LPAs stated the purpose of the inspection to the STRTP representative. During the inspection the following topics were inspected: STAFFING RECORDS: During the inspection review, LPA Humberto inspected eight (8) staff files and verified that all facility staff was subject to criminal records review, fingerprinted and cleared DOJ, FBI and CACI. Interviews were conducted with 7 staff and 3 clients. LPAs conducted a tour of Gregory Cottage, the water temperature that measured at 116 degrees. At the conclusion of the inspection, LPAs discussed the findings with the facility Program Director. cont# LPAs issued an Advisory Note-Technical Violation. The facility representative was provided information on where to locate Provider Information Notices (PINs), and shared PIN 21-20-CRP Compliance and Regulatory Enforcement (CARE) Tools, for Children's Residential licensees. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the facility representative. Exit interview conducted.

On August 18, 2021, at 9:00AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Melissa Dalziel. The purpose of the inspection was gather information regarding an incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on Wednesday, 01/27/2021, at approximately 12:37PM, Child Ref #1 (see Confidential Names form LIC811 dated 08/18/2021) was restrained for been non-responsive to the staff instructions and due to his unsafe behavior C1 was restrained. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Staff Ref #1. A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were made and obtained upon request. The information revealed that on 01/27/2021, C1 left his cottage due to being on scooter restrictions and proceeded toward the nurse's station with staff S1 following him. When C1 arrived at the nurse's station, C1 climbed onto the roof of the nurse's station building using a maintenance ladder that was left unattended and lining against the nurse's station building. cont# Staff Ref #2 (S2) arrived and redirected C1 to come down from the roof. C1 got off the roof and was non-responsive and began to take various items off a maintenance cart and began to throw them at staff. C1 was redirected by S2; however, he continued and was non-responsive. Due to C1 unsafe behavior, C1 was placed in a standing restraint at approximately (12:37PM-12:42PM, duration 5 minutes). S2 was on the right and S1 on the left (both Pro-Act. Trained). At 12:39PM PM, Staff Ref #3 (Pro-ACT Trained) arrived and switched out with S1 on the right. S3 attempted crisis communication with C1, but he was unresponsive. The restraint was conducted in the area between the nurse's station building and the cafeteria. Due to C1 continuous attempts to release himself by maneuvering his arms, C1 was transitioned to a floor restraint at 12:42PM. Staff Ref #4 (S4) (Pro-ACT Trained) arrived and switched with S1 on the left side at 12: PM. At approximately 12: PM Assistant Director Patricia White was contacted to approve an extension over the initial 15 minutes. While in the restraint, C1 continued to threaten to harm staff resulting in the continuation of the restraint. At 12: PM, S1 grabbed C1's legs due to repeatedly attempting to roll over and release himself from containment. At 12:57, Staff Ref #5 (Pro-ACT Trained) arrived and switched out with S1 on the legs. The nurse was notified at approximately 12: PM and Nurse Jonathan Alcantara arrived at approximately 12: PM. cont.# During the floor restraint C1 made several attempts to lift his body to free himself from containment, C1 maneuvered his arms attempting to pull them into his body as well as attempting to lift his legs up and down. Staff #6 (S6) arrived and attempted to fresh face with C1, however, C1 continued to struggle making threats to punch staff. According to the SIR, S2 was contacted and approved the 30-minute restraint extension. After several minutes, C1 agreed to talk with S3 and was released from the restraint at 1: PM when C1 appeared to be at baseline behavior. Case Manager Claudia Espinosa notified C1's County Social Worker via voicemail at 4:25 pm. C1 was assessed by On Call Clinician Adesha Porcil at 4:15PM. STRTP management was notified. During the file review LPA Flores did not observe in C1's file the written approval to continue the restraint after the initial 30 minutes from the Administrator. A copy of this report, LIC811 and LIC9102 was provided to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted.

On August 20, 2021, at 9:00AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Melissa Dalziel. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information regarding an incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on 1/17/2021, Child Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 dated 08/20/2021) was restrained due been in another child's room, taking items the other child and pushing staff and no following instructions when C1 was re-directed. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Staff Ref #1 (S1) and Ref #2 (S2). A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were obtained upon request. The statements and documentation reviewed revealed that on 1/17/2021, at 9:48PM, C1 his cottage without permission. S1 shadowed C1 as he ran towards the parking lot. C1 attempted to open the doors of several vehicles but was unsuccessful. S1 notified S2 and Staff Ref #3 (S3). cont# S2 and S3 encouraged C1 to return to his cottage and C1 complied. After C1 arrived at the cottage he refused to enter his room and remained in the living area. S2 asked C1to transition to his room and he complied. Minutes later resident C1 walked in another child's room without permission. S1 and S2 remained at the door and encouraged resident C1 to exit the other child's room. C1 did not comply. S2 offered C1 to walk outside of the cottage, if C1 would like to take space outside with staff but C1 did not respond. S3 came to the help and re-directed C1, but C1 was still escalated and did not respond to the staff's request to exit the room. C1 grabbed several of the other child's personal items from inside the room. S1 and S2 verbally redirected C1 several times to exit the room; but C1 did not comply and began to push S2 multiples times. Due to C1's physical aggression, C1 was placed in a two-person escort (S Hall left side / S1 right side, both ProcAct trained) from 9:57PM - 9:58PM (a duration of 1 minute). C1 dropped his weight to free himself from the escort. C1 was transitioned into a wall restraint from 9:58PM - 9:59PM (a total restraint duration of 2 minutes). Once released, C1 took space in his room and remained in his room for the remainder of the night. On Monday, January 18, 2021, at approximately 9:05AM Nurse Brittini Cochran assessed C1 with no health concerns noted or reported. cont # Currently C1 is re-unified with his biological family. No further inspection is needed at this time. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the facility representative. Exit interview conducted.

On August 20, 2021, at 9:00AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Melissa Dalziel. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information regarding an incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on 02/04/2021, Child Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 dated 08/20/2021) ran away from the facility because he no longer wanted to stay in foster care. C1 turned 18 years old (y/o) on 02/06/2021. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Melissa Dalziel. A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were obtained upon request. The statements and documentation reviewed revealed that on Thursday, 02/04/2021, at approximately 12:15PM, C1 ran away from the STRTP because he will turn 18 y/o on 02/06/2021. Assistant Director Patricia White and Campus Supervisor Jason Kubanis counseled C1 against his actions; but C1 continued to state that he was about to turn 18 y/o no longer had to remain in placement. cont.# STRTP followed C1 with an STRTP vehicle. C1 walked throughout the community with staff maintaining a visual of him. Visual was lost at 1:20PM, when C1 entered the vehicle of an unknown person. San Dimas Sheriff's Department was contacted at 2:10PM. A Deputy arrived at the STRTP and a Missing Person Report (MPR) was filed. The facility representative disclosed that on 12/22/2020, a Child Family Team (CFT) meeting was held and C1 stated that he wanted to transition to a Transitional Housing Program (THP) placement or Supervised Independent Living Placement (SILP), copy of the meeting was provided. The facility representative disclosed that on 01/20/2021, C1 attended a THP orientation at Olive Crest and decided to move forward with placement and was complaint with attending 2 sessions to complete his Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA) application for college. On 02/06/2021, C1 was discharged from the facility and his bed was closed. LPA Flores observed that facility did not provide a follow-up SIR within six months since the initial SIR was submitted. An Advisory Note-Technical Violation was issued. A copy of this report, LIC811 and LIC9102 was provided to the facility. Exit interview conducted.

On August 23, 2021, at 9:00AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information regarding an incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on 02/08/2021, Children Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 dated 08/20/2021) was restrained and escorted out of the cottage for 2 minutes because he refused to exit a staff office and did not return a dangerous item. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Patricia White. A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were obtained upon request. The information revealed that on 02/08/2021, in Whittier Cottage, C1 entered the kitchen area while Child Ref #2 (C2) was in the kitchen, Staff Ref #1 (S1) verbally redirected C1 to exit the Kitchen to wait and enter once C2 exited. C1 became visibly upset and ignored staff. C1 then began to repeatedly open and close the refrigerator door forcefully. cont.# After several verbal redirects, C1 exited the kitchen and walked toward the hallway. C1 then began to slam the door repeatedly. S1 offered C1 to take space outside with staff but he did not comply. C1 then stopped slamming the door after another resident encouraged him to stop. S1 then fresh-faced with Staff Ref #2 (S2) and entered the staff office to update the communication log. Moments later S2 opened the staff door to place an item inside. C1 then pushed through staff and entered the office without permission. S1 verbally redirected C1 to exit but he did not comply. At this time, S2 exited the cottage to shadow another child that exited without informing staff. C1 opened the staff desk drawer and began to take several of the items, among them a push pen. S1 offered C1 to do an arts and crafts activity with staff. S1 radioed Campus Supervisors for additional assistance. Staff Ref #3 (S3) and Ref #4 (S4) arrived to assist. Due to C1 refusing to leave and having an unsafe item in his hand he was escorted out by S3 right side and S4 (Both Proact trained) at approximately 1:45 p.m. - 1:47 p.m. (duration 2 minutes). Once C1 was escorted out of the cottage he was released and S1 successfully retrieved the push pen. C1then began to walk away from staff. After several minutes being on school grounds, C1 took space with at the basketball courts. cont.# C1 debriefed this incident with staff on 02/09/2021. The onsite nurse conducted a check on C1 on 02/09/2021 around 6:56PM and re-integrated into the STRTP program. No further inspection is needed. A copy of this report and LIC811 was to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted.

On August 24, 2020, at 12:00PM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information about the incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR): The STRTP reported that on 01/04/2020, 4:30PM, Child Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 2/20/20) was placed on a restrained for 60 minutes due to aggressively pursue Staff Ref #1 (S1) and aggressively struck him on his face, shoulder, arm, leg, and stomach with his cast. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Patricia White, S1 and S2. A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were obtained upon request. The statement obtained and documentation reviewed revealed that on 01/04/2020, at 4:30 pm Staff Ref #1 (S1) Children Ref #2 (C2) and C1 to an outing. After one hour into playing, both Children decided that they wanted to go back to the STRTP because they were bored but requested to trade in the rest of their play times for snacks (playtime can be changed for snack at the outing location). # S1 informed the Children that the approved outing was for Children to complete 4 hours of play, and there was no agreement about trading the play for the snacks. However, S1 agreed to ask if it was possible to trade one hour of play for snacks. Children asked clerk at the counter if they could trade one hour of play for the snacks, but the clerk said they needed to trade in all three hours. As previously agreed upon, staff informed Children that this was not possible as hours need to be saved for their next trip. C1 was not receptive to this situation and became escalated making threats to S1 that he would strike him if he did not get his snacks. S1 redirected and notify C1 that he could have a snack when they get back to the treatment facility. C1 refused and aggressively struck S1 in the face with his fist. S1 redirected and attempted to evade C1 asking him to stop, but C1 continued to aggressively pursue C1 and aggressively struck him on his face, shoulder, arm, leg, and stomach with his cast. Staff Ref #2 (S2) who was there with other children assisted by attempting to fresh face to help deescalate the situation. S2 offered to buy C1 the snacks he wanted if he stops hitting S1, however C1 was not receptive and turned his aggression toward S2 and started to aggressively strike him. Due to C1's unsafe and aggressive behavior, C1 was placed in a standing restraint with S1 on the right and S2 on the left, both ProAct trained, at approximately 5:30PM - 5:35PM ( Minutes). # C1 began biting, kicking, and spitting at staff, so S1 and S2 then transitioned C1 into a two-person floor restraint at approximately 5:35 pm - 6:30 pm ( Minutes). As restraint was approaching the 15-minutes mark former STRTP Director Talesha Payne was contacted to approve the extended restraint which she did. C1 continue to be aggressive and not receptive as the 30-minute mark was approaching; STRTP Talesha Payne was again contacted to approve the continuation of the restraint, which she did. C1 was still not calming down and continued to struggle and kick and bite and spit while screaming and threatening staff. Local law enforcement was contacted. Two Fontana police officers arrived at approximately 6:30PM. C1 was able to deescalate when he saw the police officers. C1 was released from the restraint and assisted him in sitting up on the grass area as he agreed to stop assaulting them. The two officers asked S1 and S2 to step away and spoke to C1. After meeting with Officers C1 appeared calm and was given time to take space until he agreed to enter the STRTP vehicle and return to campus. During the file review of C1, LPA Flores did not observe the written approval from former STRTP Director Talesha Payne. An Advisory Note / Technical Violation was issued. No further inspection is needed at this time. A copy of this report, LIC811 and LIC9201 was provided to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted.

On August 23, 2021, at 1:00, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information regarding an incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on 01/02/2020, Patricia White observed Child Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 dated 08/24/2021) had a black eye. Patricia asked C1 how he got the black eye, C1 replied by saying "your staff" Staff Ref #1 (S1) (STRTP staff) hit me in the eye". LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Patricia White and Krysti Robb. A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were obtained upon request. The statement obtained and documentation reviewed revealed that on 01/02/2020, around 11:30AM, Patricia White was walking down the hallway in Gregory Cottage looking for staff Nevin Flores. After reaching Staff Nevin Flores, C1 walked out of the laundry room. cont.# Patricia noticed that C1 had a black eye and asked him about it. C1 stated that on Monday 12/30/19, S1 punched him in the face and caused the black eye. Patricia immediately notified former STRTP Director Talesha Payne of this allegation. Talesha Payne asked for C1 to be brought to her office. C1 soon arrived, with Staff Nevin Flores, and when asked by Talesha Payne what happen to his eye, he stated that he was unsure of what happened to his eye as this happened when he was intoxicated on 12/30/2019. Patricia White reminded C1 of the allegation made regarding S1 hitting him in the eye, but C1 remained quiet. STRTP Director Talesha asked C1 again what happened to his eye, but C1 stated he was not sure because it happened when he was intoxicated. STRTP Director immediately contacted Health Services and spoke to nurse Genevive Andrade and Shawna Galbraith. The Nurses stated that on the day of the initial incident (12/30/2019) they assessed C1, but they did not notice a black eye at the time of their assessment. C1 was again counseled by Patricia White and former STRTP Director Talesha, but C1 did not confirm the statement initially made to Patricia White. According to the SIR, on 1/7/ Treatment Counselor Krysti Robb reported to STRTP Clinical Director Hillary Hodgson having witness, on 12/30/2019, a possible inappropriate interaction between S1 and C1. # Krysti Robb reported hearing C1 asking S1 to leave him alone, and when Kristy Robb turned into that direction she saw S1 raise his arm and going into the direction of C1's face. Krysti Robb reported to be a significant distance away, so she is not sure if there was physical contact. Additionally, Krysti reported that she did not immediately report this interaction because she was a distance away, and being dark and hard to see exactly what happened. On 1/10/20, Deputy Romero of the LA County Sheriff's Department, San Dimas Station, arrived at the treatment facility to investigate the allegation made by C1 regarding S1. Deputy Romero interviewed other children and informed to Talesha Payne that none of the children witnessed C1 being punched by S1. Deputy Romero informed Talesha Payne that some of the children stated that other children were attempting to blackmail S1 for money by making allegations. Talesha Payne informed Deputy Romero that C1 was discharged from the STRTP and is currently on a psychiatric hold at a hospital where he is scheduled to be discharged from there within the hour. Deputy Romero stated that he will contact Ms. Payne after speaking with C1 and S1. In afternoon of 1/10/20, Deputy Romero contacted Talesha Payne and informed her that during his interview with C1 he stated that on 12/30/2019, he was highly intoxicated on Vodka and did not recall S1 punching him in the eye. # C1 stated that while on runaway status with another child, he was smoking and drinking, and the other child was involved in an altercation. Deputy Romero reported that he followed up by asking C1 why he was currently in the hospital, and C1 stated that he got drunk and made statements that he wanted to kill himself. Deputy Romero asked C1 if he was still suicidal and C1 stated that he was never suicidal, he just wanted his social worker to move his placement. After Deputy Romero talked with C1, Deputy Romero contacted S1 who denied being physically aggressive towards C1. On 01/29/2020, S1 was terminated from the STRTP. An Advisory Note / Technical Violation was issued. No further inspection is needed at this time. A copy of this report, LIC811 and LIC9201 was provided to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted.

On August 20, 2020, at 12:00PM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information about the incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR): The STRTP reported that on Monday 01/06/2020, 4:10PM, Child Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 2/20/20) was restrained because he escalated and became disruptive and antagonizing toward his peers during a group game. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Patricia White. A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were obtained upon request. The statement obtained and documentation reviewed revealed that on 01/06/2020, C1 reported being upset because one of his team members (peers) responded with the incorrect answer during the jeopardy game. Staff redirected and attempted to counsel resident, but he was not receptive and walked out of the cottage as Treatment Counselor Staff Ref #1 (S1) closely followed. # C1 walked outside and sat down on the floor while continue to escalate as he became verbally aggressive towards S1 calling her names and demanding for staff to open the door while aggressively invading her personal space and making threats. S1 immediately redirected and called for assistance. Lead Treatment Counselor Staff Ref #2 (S2) came to assist and prompted C1 to continue to take space outside until he was calm and told him that once he was fully de-escalated he will be able to re-enter the cottage. C1 was not receptive to staff's counseling and began to kick and bang on the door with his feet, while making treats to kill S2. S2 encouraged C1 to calm down so he can come inside the cottage. C1 ignored staff S2 and escalated making threats to kill him, eventually attempting to aggressively kick staff in the private area. S2 was able to evade, but C1 continue his aggressive behavior while swinging his closed fists as he moved closer to staff. S2 immediately called Campus Supervisor Ref #3 (S3) for support while Therapeutic Behavior specialist Ref #4 (S4) who was nearby assisted in redirecting C1. C1 continue his aggressive behavior and continued to aggressively charge toward S2. This time, staff was not able to evade, and C1 kicked him twice in his private area. Treatment Counselor Staff Ref #4 (S4) arrived to assist, but C1 kept attempting aggression toward staff. At this time due to C1's increase aggression, and safety concerns he was placed into a standing restraint at 4:20pm with S4 on the left and S2 on the right (both ProAct trained). # C1 escalated and started to aggressively attempt to bite and kick staff, so he was transitioned to a floor restraint by the same staff. At 4:22pm, Campus Supervisors Ref #5 (S5) and S3, assisted with securing C1's legs. C1 was able to de-escalate and was released at 4:26pm (total restraint time 6 minutes). C1 was able to take space outside the cottage and then walked over to the nurse station and was seen by Nurse Brittini Cochran, Licensed Vocational Nurse at 4:36PM. Copy of the debrief form with staff and C1 was provided. The facility representative stated the C1 was re-integrated to the facility's program. No deficiency was cited. No further inspection is needed at this time. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the facility representative. Exit interview conducted.

On September 2, 2021, at 9:00AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information regarding an incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on 7/20/21, at approximately 6:30PM, Treatment Counselor Jun Wei Kao (JW) took Children Ref #1 (C1), Ref #2 (C2), Ref #3 (C3) and Ref #4 (C4) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 dated 09/02/2021) to the dining hall to play there at the Children's request. The Children were constantly entering and exiting the curtains, and had their heads sticking out of the bottom of the curtain to allow JW to maintain visual at all times. A few minutes later C3 went behind the closed curtain to clean up the stage. During the cleanup, C3 walked up to the curtain and looked behind it and verbally informed JW that C1 and C2 were "doing it". LPA Flores investigated the incident. An interview was conducted with Patricia White. C2 and C3 refused to talk to LPA Flores. cont.# A review of the Children's files was conducted, and copies were obtained. Currently JW is not at the STRTP. LPA Flores attempted to talk over the phone with JW, but unsuccessful. Further inspection is needed to complete the investigation. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted.

On August 23, 2021, at 9:00AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information regarding an incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on 02/07/2021, Children Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 dated 08/20/2021) was hit, in the forehead, by C2 with a skateboard. C1 sustained a laceration approximately 4 cm in length. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Patricia White and C1. A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were made upon request. The information revealed that 02/07/2021, at approximately 4:50PM C1 and C2 were watching Superbowl LV, in the cafeteria and after the game ended C1 and C2 left the cafeteria, C1 and C2 were having a conversation and began to horseplay. Staff Ref #1 (S1) redirected the children to discontinue this behavior, and the children complied. C2 noticed C1's skateboard on the ground and picked it up. C1 asked C2 multiple times to return the skateboard, however, C2 refused. cont.# Staff Ref #1 redirected the children to discontinue this behavior, and the children complied. C2 noticed C1's skateboard on the ground and picked it up. C1 asked C2 multiple times to return the skateboard, however, C2 refused. S1 asked C2 to return the skateboard, but C2 refused to do so. Both children approached the volleyball net, next to Unit 2, C1 told C2 that if he did not return the skateboard he would pour his root beer soda on C2. C2 became visibly upset and told C1 not to do it because he was wearing clothes that C2's mother had giving him for his birthday. S1 got in between both children to prevent a fight between both children and asked C1 not to pour drink on C1 and for C2 to return the skateboard to C1. S1 got out of the way to allow C2 to return the skateboard, then C1 poured his drink on C2's pants and C2 threw the skateboard at C1 like a "chest pass" and hit C1 in the forehead. C1 was then transported to the Emergency Room where he was examined. C1's laceration was glued and closed. C1 was giving home care instructions not to wash the area for 7 days. C1 disclosed that C2 did not have the intention to hurt him and that they were good friends before the incident and are still good friends. On the same date of the incident C1 apologized to C2 and vice versa. No further inspection is needed at this time. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the STRTP representative.

On September 2, 2021, at 9:00AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information regarding an incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on 07/11/2020, at approximately 8:15PM, Child Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 dated 09/02/2021) disclosed to Staff Krysti Robb (KR), that he took 29 triple C pills (Coricidin), Xanax, and Percocet. C1 was in his room vomiting. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Patricia White. A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were obtained upon request. The statement obtained and documentation reviewed revealed that on 7/11/2021, around 8:15PM, KR observed C1 exit the Cottage restroom. KR noticed C1 appeared to be off-balance as he walked to his room. Moments later KR heard what appeared to be C1 vomiting in his room. cont.# KR went to check on C1, and he disclosed to KR that he felt like he was going to overdose because C1 stated that he took 29 triple C pills (Coricidin), Xanax, and Percocet. Paramedics were called and C1 was transported to the Emergency Room. C1 was diagnosed with an unintentional overdose. Toxicology report revealed that C1 tested for marijuana. The STRTP representative disclosed that C1 did not state where he got the pills from. According to Patricia White, children often steal medication from local pharmacies when they run away from the STRTP, and pharmacy's employees do not contact local police unless there is an assault against the employee of the store. Patricia White indicated that C1 was not prescribed any of the medication that he voluntary ingested. No further inspection is needed. No deficiency was cited. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted.

On September 23, 2021, at 9:00AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information regarding an incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR #1). The STRTP reported that on Wednesday 03/03/2021, at approximately 8:55AM Child Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names List form LIC811 dated 09/23/2021) walked out of Gregory Cottage despite ongoing redirects and was escorted for 2 minutes to prevent C1 from running away from the facility. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Patricia White. A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were obtained upon request. The statement and documentation reviewed revealed that on 03/03/2021, around 8:55AM, C1 walked out of Gregory Cottage despite ongoing redirects. Staff Ref #1 (S1) followed C1 and called for assistance. cont.# Staff Ref #2 (S2) and Ref #3 (S3) arrived for support. Staff encouraged C1 to return to the Cottage and, according to the SIR, reminded him about his containment plan due to safety concerns. C1 continued to walk toward the front of campus stating he was leaving the facility. Around 9:00AM, C1 was escorted from 9:00AM to 9:02AM, 2 minutes escort, to the Recreation Center by S2 on the right side and S3 on the left side, both Pro-Act trained. C1 was released at 9:02AM, once he was at the recreation center. C1 took space in the Recreation Center until he was assessed by Nurse Brittany Cochran. Patricia White disclosed that the reason that C1 was restrained was due to his unsafe behavior whenever he would run away from the facility, C1 would run into the middle of the street, would destroy property, would get into local hospital facility and store, as it happened on 03/02/2021. According to SIR#2, on 03/02/2021, C1 ran away from the facility and entered a local hospital and requested to be transferred to a mental health facility. The staff at the local hospital informed C1 that they could not do that. Then C1 left the hospital and went to a local store, and asked the clerk to call Local Sheriff Department (LSD). When LSD arrived C1 asked the Officer to look for a mental health institution for him. LSD did not find a mental health facility that would admit C1 and, after those options were exhausted, C1 was transported, by LSD, back to the STRTP. cont.# During the documentation review LPA Flores did not observe documentation that would authorize the STRTP to restraint C1 for attempting to run away. An Advisory Note / Technical Violation was issued. A copy of this report, LIC811 and LIC9102 was provided to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted.

On September 23, 2021, at 9:00AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information regarding an incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on 03/24/2020, Child Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names List form LIC811 dated 09/23/2021) informed Staff Clarissa Sanchez that Child Ref #2 (C2) struck him with a closed fist on his left arm. C1 showed Staff Clarissa Sanchez and Case Manager Claudia Espinoza a total of three bruises located on his left arm. Campus Supervisor / Unit Manager Angela Christian was contacted immediately about this incident. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Patricia White and Melissa Dalziel. A review of the Children's files was conducted, and copies were obtained upon request. The statements and documentation reviewed revealed that on 03/24/2021, a Deputy from the San Dimas Sheriff Department arrived on-site to interview C1 and C2 regarding the incident reported. cont.# The Deputy stated that he will return on 03/25/2021. On 03/25/2021, the Deputy returned to the STRTP and talked with C1 and C2. Both Children were told to keep distance from each other and to keep hands to themselves. The Deputy informed the STRTP that C2 would not be arrested instead, C2 would be given a warning. C1 and C2 were able to discuss this incident with their individual therapist. No further inspection is needed at this time. No deficiency was cited. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted.

Based on the interviews, the allegations are found to be unsubstantiated. Although the allegation may have happened or are valid, there is not a preponderance of the evidence to prove the allegations During the exit interview copies of LIC9099, LIC9099C, LIC811, and Appeals rights were discussed with the Name and position. There were no deficiencies cited.

narrative: On September 30, 2021, at 11:00AM, Monique Turner-Marshall, Regional Manager (RM), Tira Logan-Shanks, Licensing Program Manager (LPM), Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an Office Meeting via Microsoft Team App with Anil Vadaparty, Chief Enterprise Officer (CEO), Melissa Dalziel, Senior Vice-President (SVP), Dustin Vanderhaard, Administrator, and Patricia White, Program Director of McKinley Children's Center Short Term Therapeutic Program (STRTP). From the placement agencies attended the meeting: Teresa de la Rosa, Department of Children and Family Services (DCFS) Orange County, Crystal Bernal, DCFS Los Angeles County (LAC), Lasha Dalton, LAC DCFS and Claudia Terrero, Out of Home Care Investigation Section (OHCIS). During the meeting LPA Flores analyzed a summary of Annual Inspections, a summary of Complaint History, STRTP internal review of the use of Emergency Interventions / Bi-Annual Letter/6 months of review of manual restraints and a summary of Case Management. The Program Statement (PS) and Plan of Operation (POO) of the STRTP was reviewed. cont.# The STRTP was advised to revise and update the PS and POO according to the last version of the Interim Licensing Standard (ILS) Version 3.1. The facility representatives were informed that during the review process the following Sections of the PS and POO were evaluated: - Section 4. Core Services and Support. - Section 5. Trauma informed treatment and practices. - Section 14. Personal Rights. - Section 15. House Rules. - Section 17. Positive Discipline Policies. - Section 22. Emergency intervention plan and run-away plan. The STRTP will ensure that all revisions are submitted by November 1, 2021. A copy of this report was provided to the STRTP representatives. Exit interview conducted.

On 05/05/2021, the Department received a complaint alleging that staff did not prevent youth from AWOL's. LPA conducted interviews with four (4) staff whom witnessed the event and three (3) youths. Staff denied the allegation. Based on interviews conducted with staff it was revealed that multiple youth ran away on 04/27/21 and staff did try to prevent youth from leaving the facility by counseling youth not to leave and by following them off campus until they lost visual. Also, that staff does not use physical restraints on the youth when they ran away from the facility. Based on interviews conducted with youth it was revealed by two youths that staff did try to prevent youth from leaving the facility; however, one youth stated that staff did not try to stop youth from leaving. Based on conflicting statements this allegation could not be corroborated. It was alleged that staff did not prevent self-harming behavior while minor was in care. The facility staff denied the allegation. Based on interviews conducted with staff whom witnessed this incident it was revealed that on 04/28/21 during a meeting with staff the youth grabbed a pair of scissors, ran out of the office and left the facility. Interviews revealed that staff followed behind youth and alerted the San Dimas Sheriff's Department about youth making self-harming statements and having in possession a pair of scissors. Consequently, the youth was found by the San Dimas Sheriff's Department and was hospitalized and placed on a psychiatric hold for making self-harming statements. LPA interviewed the placement agency social worker whom indicated that the incident was reported timely and did not have any safety concerns with facility staff. Based on interviews conducted, one youth stated that staff did not try to prevent youth from self-harming and the other two youth disclosed that staff did call the police to report the youth had a pair of scissors. Based on conflicting statements this allegation could not be corroborated. It was alleged that staff made inappropriate comments towards minor. The facility staff denied this allegation. Based on interviews conducted with staff whom were present it was revealed that no one witnessed or heard a staff make inappropriate comments towards minor in care. It was revealed by youth that inappropriate comments were made by staff on 04/28/21 but that no one else witnessed it. Based on interviews conducted with youths it was revealed that one is affirming inappropriate comments were made and the other two denied witnessing or having heard any staff make inappropriate comments. Throughout, the interviews LPA observed conflicting statements regarding this allegation and was unable to corroborate whether the allegation was true. Although the allegations may have happened or are valid, there is not a preponderance of evidence to prove the above allegation{s} did or did not happen, therefore, the above allegations are being closed UNSUBSTANTIATED. No deficiencies were cited during this inspection. An exit interview was conducted and copy of this report was provided at the time of visit.

Additional Interviews were conducted on 10/07/21 with S4 and S5 and attempted to interview S6 & S7. (Please refer to Confidential Names List dated 10/07/21). narrative: Continue from page 1 . . . Statements obtained from the interviews conducted with staff revealed that a client pulled down his pants and exposed his buttocks briefly to another client while out in the facility field. Staff (S1) which was the assigned staff to the clients stated that she had the door open to keep a visual on the client and asked another staff to watch the clients while she took a restroom break. S1 stated that she had radio other staff (campus supervision) for assistance but never got a reply, S1 stated that she was not sure who heard the call for assistance. Staff (S5) stated that S1 asked him for a restroom break and asked him to watch the clients and watched the clients in the cottage but S1 never disclosed that the other clients were out in the field. Other staff interviewed indicated that S1 did not radio the other staff for assistance. The confidential interviews indicated that the a client pulled down his pants and flashed another client while out in the field. The confidential interviews indicated that there was other staff around but the clients did not have direct supervision. The facility management provided video surveillance footage where the client is seen going in and out of the cottage and S1 followed him outside the cottage door, turned around, wrote something and went inside the cottage. The staff (S1) is seen coming back to the outside of the cottage after a few minutes. Based on the staff statements, confidential interviews, records reviewed and video footage it was determined that the clients were left without direct supervision by the assigned staff, therefore, the allegations are found to be substantiated. A substantiated finding means that the preponderance of evidence standard has been met and the allegations are found to be true. Exit interview completed. The following deficiencies cited and a copy of this report and appeal rights were left with facility representative mention above. End of report.

narrative: On November 18, 2021, at 8:50AM, Humberto Flores and Heriberto Perez, Licensing Program Analysts (LPAs), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection, at McKinley Children's Center Short Therapeutic Residential Treatment Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information about the below incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on Wednesday, April 14th, 2021, Child Ref #1 (C1), had access to sharp items from the maintenance area. The SIR also reported that C1 was restrained due to unsafe behaviors. LPA Flores and Perez investigated the incident and interviewed Patricia White. A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were made upon request. The statement obtained and documentation reviewed revealed that on 04/14/2021, C1 got upset with another child at Whittier Cottage. C1 walked towards the dinning hall and locked himself inside of it with another child. Staff Ref #1 (S1) Clarissa Sanchez persuaded C1 to exit the dinning hall area and C1 started to use profanities and stuck his middle finger out, then later unlocked the door and exited the dinning room area. cont.# C1 returned to Whittier Cottage and walked towards his room and closed the hallway door behind him. Staff Danielle Chiong shadowed C1 and opened the hallway door. C1 then exited his room with a clenched fist and walked in the direction of the child's room (from the previous incident). Staff Clarissa Sanchez stood in front of C1 as a precautionary measure. C1 then began to push a bench in the direction of Staff Jun Wei-Kao, but Staff Jun Wei-Kao was able to evade. Staff Clarissa Sanchez fresh-faced with Staff Jun Wei-Kao and asked C1 if he would like to take space outside with staff. C1 declined and continued to try to get to the other child. Due to C1 increased aggression, he was placed in a moving restraint with Staff Clarissa Sanchez left side and Wagner Contreras right side (Both ProAct trained) from approximately 5:18PM- 5:19PM (duration one minute). C1 was transitioned to the patio area of unit 1 and was released from containment at 5:19PM. Campus Supervisors were notified about the incident. Upon being released, C1 ran toward the maintenance area of the facility with Staff Clarissa Sanchez and Wagner Contreras following behind him. While in the maintenance area, Noel got a hold of two sharp metal objects and proceeded to make his way towards the parking lot. cont. # The facility representative stated none of the staff that witnessed the incident remember what type of "sharp tool" C1 had access to. LPAs Flores and Perez conducted a walked through in the maintenance area and observed that all areas were locked, and no sharp tools were accessible. No further inspection is needed. No citation was issued. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the facility representative. Exit interview conducted.

On December 2, 2021, at 12:15PM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an announced Case Management Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Therapeutic Residential Treatment (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. LPA Flores stated the purpose of the inspection to the STRTP representative. LPA Flores conducted an inspection of Whittier and Kiwanis Cottage to ensure that the extra room that the facility intends to add to each Cottage, meets the standards that the laws and regulations require. The rooms have ample space that allow the facility to house 1 child in each room. There is a door, glass windows and enough space to place drawers. There is a bathroom and closet that the facility plans to limit the access to by installing a wall. The facility representative stated the child placed in those rooms would have access to the same bathrooms, that the rest of the children placed at each Cottage, have access to. No further inspection is needed. A copy of this report was provided to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted.

On December 2, 2021, at 11:06AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection, at McKinley Children's Center Short Therapeutic Residential Treatment Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information about the below incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). On 3/29/2021, the STRTP reported that Child's Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names List 811 dated 12/02/2021) biological father informed the facility that during C1's home visit he told the family that Child Ref #2 (C2) performed oral sex on C1 in a park while both children were on run away status. C1 also disclosed to his father that due to be in love with C2 he no longer wanted to reunify with his family. C1's father indicated that his son had told him that he was subdued by 9 sheriffs. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Patricia White. A review of C1's and C2's files was conducted, and copies were obtained upon request. The statement and documentation reviewed revealed that the alleged incident between C1 and C2, happened around a month prior to 3/29/2021 and while they ran away from the facility, according to statements that both children provided to former Administrator Talesha Payne. cont.# The SIR indicates that the children disclosed that it was a one-time consensual act out of the care and supervision of staff from the facility and no other incidents have occurred. C1's father was informed that his son has been subdued, at the facility, by 9 sheriffs and that C1's statement was not based on facts. C1 was discharged from the STRTP on 07/01/2021, and C2 on 05/04/2021. No further inspection is needed. No citation was issued. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the facility representative. Exit interview conducted.

It was alleged that a facility client was sexually abused by another client at the facility due to neglect and lack of supervision. The investigation revealed that two facility clients became involved in sexual activities on two occasions during the month of June 2021 while unsupervised behind facility buildings. The incidents became known when the client who was sexually abused informed another client who then reported to staff. The facility incident report was obtained in this investigation. Confidential statements obtained from one of the facility clients indicated that the sexual abuse occurred. Based on the information gathered, the preponderance of evidence to prove the allegation was met, therefore the allegation is substantiated per California Code of Regulations Title 22 - refer to LIC9099-D for deficiencies. Per the new Civil Penalty laws, Health and Safety (H&S) Code section 1548(E), an Enhanced Civil Penalty (ECP) determination is pending due to the substantiated allegation. If an ECP is warranted, a Community Care Licensing (CCL) representative will return to the facility to deliver the penalty assessment. A copy of this report, Confidential Names Form, LIC 9099-D for deficiency and Appeal Rights were provided to the agency representative.

narrative: It was alleged that a facility client was sexually abused by another client at the facility due to neglect and lack of supervision. The investigation revealed that two facility clients engaged in a sexual interaction behind stage curtains in the recreational building while under the supervision of a facility staff. The sexual activity was discovered by another facility client who reported it to the staff. By the time the staff walked up to the stage area, both clients were securing their pants. The client who reported the incident to staff refused to make any statements to Investigator Spindola, but the staff told Investigator Spindola that the client told him that the two clients were having a sexual encounter behind the stage curtains. Confidential statements obtained from one of the facility clients indicated that the sexual abuse occurred, and he screamed for help during the incident but the staff was not in the immediate vicinity according to the client. The biological parent of the other client did not want her child interviewed regarding the allegation. Based on the fact that the facility staff allowed the clients to play behind a closed curtain for an undetermined amount of time, and the fact that this is the third similar incident that occurred in a couple of months, the allegation is substantiated. Based on the information gathered, the preponderance of evidence to prove the allegation was met, therefore the allegation is substantiated per California Code of Regulations Title 22 - refer to LIC9099-D for deficiencies. Per the new Civil Penalty laws, Health and Safety (H&S) Code section 1548(E), an Enhanced Civil Penalty (ECP) determination is pending due to the substantiated allegation. If an ECP is warranted, a Community Care Licensing (CCL) representative will return to the facility to deliver the penalty assessment. A copy of this report, Confidential Names Form, LIC 9099-D for deficiency and Appeal Rights were provided to the agency representative. It was alleged that a facility client sustained a finger fracture from being pushed by another client. The investigation revealed that while the client was speaking with his mother on the phone, another client engaged him in a verbal dispute that escalated into a physical altercation resulting in the client being pushed and falling to the ground sustaining an injury to his finger. Confidential statements obtained indicated that the client who sustained the injury was prone to engage in fights with other clients without provocation resulting in other clients retaliating against him, and some fights occur suddenly whereby staff are unable to prevent the fights due to the sudden nature. The biological parent of the client who sustained the injury did not want her child interviewed regarding the allegation. Based on the information gathered, the allegation is unsubstantiated as the preponderance of evidence to prove the allegation was not met although the allegation may have happened or is valid. A copy of this report, Confidential Names Form and Appeal Rights were provided to the facility representative. There were no deficiencies cited during this inspection.

narrative: On January 14, 2022, at 10:30AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection, at McKinley Children's Center Short Therapeutic Residential Treatment Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information about the below incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on 12/10/2021, at approximately 3:50PM, Child Ref #1 (C1) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 dated 01/14/2022) ran away from the facility without telling staff where he was going. On 12/11/2021, around 6:30PM, C1 came back to the STRTP. C1 was in possession of a gold colored necklace, wire earbuds and a skateboard. LPA Flores investigated the incident and interviewed Patricia White. A review of C1's file was conducted, and copies were obtained upon request. The statement obtained and the documentation reviewed revealed that on 12/10/2021, around 3:50PM, C1 was in the common area of Gregory Cottage talking with other children. Staff Jennifer Vega overheard another child tell C1 not to run away but C1 ignored the other child. cont.# C1 was heard saying " I don't care, I hate this place". C1 got up from the common area, got his backpack, and exited the cottage without notifying staff about where he was going. Staff Jennifer Vega encouraged C1 to make positive choices, she offered to play pool with C1 at the recreation center however, the offer was ignored. C1 answered an incoming call on his cell phone device and Staff Jennifer Vega overheard C1 tell the other person on the phone "I'll meet you at Lone Hill Middle school" and hung up. C1 exited campus and proceeded to sprint through the San Dimas Sportsplex, causing Staff Jennifer Vega to lose visual at 3:55 pm. Staff Jennifer Vega notified Campus Supervisor Jason Kubanis about the situation. Staff Jennifer Vega drove in a facility's vehicle and conducted a community search with negative results. After the two-hour mark, the San Dimas Sheriff's Department was contacted about C1's absence. A Deputy arrived at 6:10PM to file a Missing Person's Report. On Saturday, 12/11/2021, around 6:30PM, C1 returned to the STRTP on his own knocking on the cottage door. Campus Supervisor Robert Vazquez opened the door. Staff Jennifer Vega noticed that C1 returned with a gold-colored necklace, wireless earbuds, and a skateboard. When asked how he acquired the items, C1 responded "my friend bought it for me." C1 entered the Cottage with no further issues. cont.# On Sunday, 12/12/2021, at approximately 10:00AM Nurse Vanessa Meiter assessed C1 noting him to be free of injuries. The STRTP management team was notified. C1 was discharged from the STRTP on 12/17/2021. No further inspection is needed at this time. No citation was issued. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the facility representative. Exit interview conducted.

It was reported that clients daily meals are being skipped, food being provided to clients is spoiled, staff allow a client to bully other clients, and staff bully those clients when they make complaints. The Program Director at the facility, including staff workers who were mentioned or identified in the referral denied the allegations that meals provided to clients are skipped and food is spoiled. Staff workers were consistent and stated that all meals and snacks are prepared daily in the primary kitchen, including cottages having their own refrigerator with access to other fresh foods and snacks. Staff reported that clients are not allowed to physically assault other clients and will take appropriate action to control client(s) behavior. Staff working denied that they will bully those clients that wish to file a grievance towards anyone and stated that they will assist those clients in completing the form. In confidential interviews, statements obtained could not corroborate the allegations reported. One client stated that was one incident (no date provided) when his meals were skipped but then stated that facility cottage provided him with other options to have his meal after returning late in the evening from school. Other clients stated that meals are being provided without being skipped. On the matter of food is old or spoiled, two clients reportedly observed some juices/drinks in the cottage refrigerator past their "use by date" for consumption, other clients had no concerns. It was reported that staff are allowing clients to bully their peers by placing them in a choke hold or headlock. The one focused client who was identified as the minor who uses choke holds and headlocks towards his peers admitted to playfully being rough using headlocks and not choke holds. The focused client admitted to bullying others in the past. One client disclosed that he once told a staff working that the focused client plays to rough. Other clients denied that the allegation and stated that everyone plays rough and defines this as "horse playing". All clients stated that staff will normally react quickly to clients when that misbehave or when they exhibit aggressive behavior with their peers. Clients also denied that a client was physically assaulted specifically on 09/06/2021 that resulted in having a bloody nose while playing on the water slide. The clients denied the allegation, one client who had a bloody nose stated that it was accident. The facility provided a copy of the special incident report (SIR). Clients denied that staff will bully those clients who file a grievance about their treatment. Individual identified as other who provided information about the allegations could not be contacted or located and therefore no statement was obtained. The county referral dated 09/06/2021 that is associated to this complaint investigation was not investigated by the county but was evaluated out for review. Therefore, the above allegations are determined unsubstantiated at this time. A finding that the complaint is unsubstantiated means that although the allegation may have happened or is valid, there is not a preponderance of the evidence to prove that the alleged abuse occurred. An exit interview was conducted and copy of this report was provided to the facility representative for review and signature. No deficiencies were cited at this time.
investigation_findings: 13On 12/20/21 at 10: AM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Joseph Vargas conducted a follow-up inspection for the purpose of providing findings for the above complaint. LPA met with Ms. White, Program Director. During the course of the investigation, LPA conducted in-person visits and telephone interviews with five staff workers, three clients on 09/08/2021, two clients on 9/10/2021, including multiple attempts to contact one county social worker (reference confidential names list LIC811 dated 12/20/2021. During the inspection LPA requested for review and obtained copy of the client's documents: client's needs and services plan and special incident reports (SIR), client roster, and current facility personnel report (LIC 500). There were no complaint related county documents and reports for review. On 09/07/2021, the Department received a complaint alleging personal rights violations by staff working at the facility. narrative: On March 14, 2022, at 1:00PM, Tira Logan-Shanks, Licensing Program Manager (LPM), Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an Informal Meeting via Microsoft Team App with Anil Vadaparty, Chief Enterprise Officer (CEO), Melissa Dalziel, Senior Vice-President (SVP), Dustin Vanderhaard, Administrator, and Patricia White, Program Director of McKinley Children's Center Short Term Residential Therapeutic Program (STRTP). During the meeting LPM Logan and LPA Flores analyzed a summary of 4 complaint investigations that resulted in the sexual abuse of a child by another child. All the sexual assaults incidents happened at the facility due to the neglect and lack of supervision of the facility staff. On 06/14/2021, the Department received a Child Protective Services (CPS) referral which indicated that one of the clients reported that another client made him perform oral sex. The investigation revealed that there were two incidents during summer of 2021, where the victim was forced to perform oral sex on another child. Both incidents occurred on the facilities grounds and while unsupervised by facility staff. This investigation was conducted by the Investigation Branch (IB) unit. A Type A citation was issued and a Plan of Correction (POC) was implemented. cont.# On 08/06/2021 and 08/30/2021, the Department received two CPS referrals which indicated that it was alleged that a facility client was sexually abused by another client at the facility due to neglect and lack of supervision by the facility staff. The investigation revealed that two facility clients engaged in a sexual interaction behind stage curtains in the recreational building while under the supervision of a facility staff. These investigations were conducted by the Investigation Branch (IB) unit. A Type A citation was issued for each investigation and POCs were implemented. On 09/30/2021, the Department received a CPS referral which indicated that one child was approached by another child, who pulled down his own pants and showed his buttocks. During the investigation it was revealed that this incident happened outside of the cottage and out in the field, with no supervision from the facility staff. A Type B citation was issued and a POC was implemented. The Licensee's representatives disclosed that new trainings have been implemented, with live scenarios and the use of real camera footage and supervising training and ongoing boundaries training. The facility representatives disclosed that disciplinary actions have been taken with the employees that did not show good judgement and their actions led to these incidents. A copy of this report was provided to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted.

C2 pulled his pants and underwear down pointed to his pubic region and said it is a bush". C2's statement was reported to a STRTP staff, but C2 denied it. On April 14, 2022, at 8:50AM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Humberto Flores, conducted an unannounced Annual Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Therapeutic Residential Treatment (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. LPA Flores stated the purpose of the inspection to the STRTP representative. During the inspection a copy of the Register of Facility Clients and Personnel Report was provided upon request. The following topics were inspected: PHYSICAL PLANT: A tour of the facility was conducted, along with Patricia White. The License is placed in a prominent place, in the reception are of the facility. Children's foster rights were posted in all Cottages: Whittier, Gregory and Campbell. LPA Flores observed that the facility is clean, safe, sanitary and in good repair. The passageways and ramps are unobstructed. There is swimming pool located in the south west area of the facility that is fenced, locked and inaccessible to the children. The disinfectants and cleaning solutions were stored away from the kitchen areas, food preparation areas to the children. cont.# The facility is also providing trauma informed core services through agreements with other agencies. The facility has a culinary arts program, cultural sensitivity, tennis, equine therapy and a music program for all clients in care. OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS: During the inspection review, LPAs observed the facility maintained an updated roster of the clients with pertinent information. The facility administrator and manager are the responsible and capable staff for communicating with emergency personnel in the facility. The facility has developed, maintained and implemented written complaint procedures. Further inspection is required on a separate day. No deficiency was observed, and no citation was issued. A copy of this report and LIC811 was provided to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted. cont.# The food is safe and of the quality and the quantity necessary to meet the needs of the clients. Each meal meets at least 1/3 of the recommended in the USDA Basic Food Group Plan-Daily Food Guide. Supplies of staples non-perishable foods for one week and perishable foods for two days are maintained in the facility. Medications are locked and accessible only to employees supervising stored medications. The temperature in the rooms that clients occupy are maintained between 68 and 85 degrees (F) and the hot water temperature was at 115 degrees (F). CLIENT RECORDS: LPA Flores reviewed the two (2) client file records. Needs and Services Plans are trauma informed, culturally relevant, and age and developmentally appropriate and identified the child's needs: reason for placement, education, personal care and grooming, ability to manage money, visitation information, mental health services and placement information CORE THERAPEUTIC SERVICES: During the inspection review, LPAs were able to see that the facility is providing the Short-Term Therapeutic Program (STRTP) core services and support to the individuals in placement. The facility has trauma informed, culturally relevant, age, and developmentally appropriate.

On April 21, 2022, at 9:30AM, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA) Humberto Flores, conducted an unannounced Annual Inspection at McKinley Children's Center Short Term Therapeutic Residential Treatment (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. LPA Flores stated the purpose of the inspection to the STRTP representative. CLIENT RECORDS: LPA Flores reviewed the two (2) client file records. Emergency Intervention Plan: LPA Flores reviewed the program statement and PROACT instruction manual and identified the training that is provided for all staff. The staff receive on-going training to maintain certification. A monthly log is utilized to document manual restraints to assist with the Bi-Annual Restraint Report. Disaster Preparedness Plan: LPA Flores reviewed the disaster and mass casualty plan and other provisions by reviewing the program statement. The facility conducts monthly fire and emergency evacuation drills. Drills are documented and kept in the facility for at least one year. cont# Disaster Preparedness Plan: LPA Flores reviewed the disaster and mass casualty plan and other provisions by reviewing the program statement. The facility conducts monthly fire and emergency evacuation drills. Drills are documented and kept in the facility for at least one year. STAFFING RECORDS: During the inspection review, LPA Humberto inspected five (5) staff files and verified that all facility staff was subject to criminal records review, fingerprinted and cleared DOJ, FBI and CACI. LPA Flores observed that 4 out of the 5 staff files did not complete the 40 hours (hrs)of annual training: S2/36.25hrs, S3/30.50hrs, S4/37.65hrs and S5/39.25hrs. The facility representative stated that the staff in charge of the training department is new and they are adjusting to the new roll. A Technical Advisory Note / Technical Violation was issued. Interviews were conducted with 2 staff and 1 client. A copy of this report, LIC9102 and LIC811 was provided to the STRTP representative. Exit interview conducted.

On May 18, 2022, at 9:00AM, Humberto Flores, Licensing Program Analyst (LPA), conducted an unannounced Case Management Inspection, at McKinley Children's Center Short Therapeutic Residential Treatment Program (STRTP) and met with Patricia White. The purpose of the inspection was to gather information about the below incident reported via Special Incident Report (SIR). The STRTP reported that on 03/07/2022, Children Ref #1 (C1), Ref #2 (C2), Ref #3 (C3) and Ref #4 (C4) (see Confidential Names form LIC811 dated 03/25/2022) were in the front area of the campus without a staff authorization. C2 pulled his pants and underwear down pointed to his pubic region and said it is a bush". C2's statement was reported to a STRTP staff, but C2 denied it. It was reported that C3 pulled down his own pants and showed his penis. C2 then grabbed C1's head to push it down toward C3's penis and told C1 "suck it". C1 stated he refused to do it. LPA Flores conducted interviews with C1; C2 and C3 refused to provide information related with this investigation. Staff Ref #1 (S1) and Ref #2 (S2) were interviewed. cont.# Documentation from the children's file was reviewed, and copies were obtained upon request and access to video footage of security cameras was granted. The information revealed that on 03/07/2022, C1, C2, C3 and C4 sat down outside of campus without the authorization from personnel from the STRTP. Staff Ref #3 (S3) was assigned to supervise the children due to been out of the main campus of the facility without an authorization. While hanging around on the curb of the side of the STRTP, C2 was walking around and slightly pulled down his pants and pointed to his private area and showed it to C1, C3 and C4 while stating "this is a bush, this is a bush". A few seconds later C2 seats on the left side of C1 and starts to rub C1's head and places his arm around C1's neck. C4 gets up and walks away from the curb. C3, that was on the right side of C1, seats closer to C1 and C2 grabs C1's head and pushed towards C3's groin area with a motion of up and down. During this time, S3 was not providing care and supervision as initially was assigned to do because he was on the other end, next to the main entrance of the facility. This is a violation of California Code of Regulations (CCR), Title XXII, Division 6, Section 80078(a) Responsibility for Providing Care and Supervision: (a) The licensee shall provide care and supervision as necessary to meet the client's needs. This is a Type A violation of the regulations and the Health and Safety Code that, if not corrected, have a direct and immediate risk to the health, safety or personal rights of those in care. cont.# This is a subsequent violation within a twelve (12) month period will result in a civil penalty of one two hundred and fifty dollars ($250) per violation was assessed. A copy of this report, citation page, appeal rights and LIC811 was provided to the facility representative. Exit interview conducted.
